userreviews.userReview: This collection of short stories take place in the fictional town of Avalon, Illinois. More character than plot driven, they are a beautiful and heartwarming stories. The stories are connected not only by being set in the same town, but some characters are in more than one story, and events are often referenced that took place in previous stories.The author's writing style reminds me of the stories by Fannie Flagg. The characters are authentic, and as soon as I finished one story, I couldn't wait to read the next one. This a good book to curl up with on a cold night with a warm blanket and a hot cup of tea.The stories really make you feel the true spirit of the Christmas season without being religious or preachy.

This heart-warming story collection portrays the spirit of Christmas as displayed by the residents of Avalon, Illinois. Some stories are more interesting than others. Characters occasionally reappear in other stories. Most of the stories mention Harmony Homes, a facility for seniors which appears to include both independent living and assisted-living portions. This collection puts the reader in the Christmas spirit. Several recipes, including the Amish Friendship Bread and variations mentioned in the text, appear following the final story.
3.5/5This was a sweet story and I enjoyed listening to it during my workout. A funny, enlightening and relaxful read.

Disheartened to say that though I liked Darien Gee's latest novel (Avalon Ladies Scrapbooking Society) taking place in Avalon I didn't really love it. If you have previously read "Friendship Bread" and "Avalon Ladies Scrapbooking Society" besides a mention and some actually sightings you don't get to follow up with characters from the previous novel that much.I on the other hand ended up loving mostly all of the 12 short stories included in this novella. I generally do like most Christmas themed books. There were only two stories that I found to be sad and not uplifting (Chapter 6: Late Bloomers and Chapter 8: And We're Wassailing) but found that besides those two that I loved the other stories.Ms. Gee does keep a narrative thread working through all of the stories about an anonymous donor and we do revisit characters that appeared in the first story and then the last. I hope in her next Avalon novel that Ms. Gee revisits some of the characters like Mary and Daryl who appeared in Chapter 1 and 12.Ms. Gee includes recipes and also provides details on how to make friendship bread. I do have plans on making some this holiday season since the recipe looks to be very easy.I recommend to those fans who want to catch up with the town of Avalon.
ThIs collection of short stories all taking place in Avalon just felt good to read during the holidays. I'm reminded of Jan Karon's Mitford series.

I really love all of Darien Gee's books as I feel when I read them, I am actually in Avalon, a warm and friendly town that treats everyone as their own. This book was just like the rest that I have read, with a compilation of various Christmas stories, all taking place in Avalon. Some of the characters are repeated throughout the stories however, most of them are newly introduced, with scenarios that depict the beauty of Christmas. As I was reading the stories, many of them I was able to picture in my mind, which made me both happy and satisfied; that is how I am able to tell how good a book is. If I can picture the plot as I'm reading, then the author did a great job of describing exactly as they should. A wonderful collection which makes you warm up to the holiday season; highly-recommended!

I absolutely adore the Friendship Bread series. When I read one, not only am I transported to Avalon but I become part of the community. Because Christmas in Avalon is a series of vignettes, only being tied together in the last one, I didn't feel as connected. Instead of becoming an Avolonian, I was an outsider looking in instead of being included. I would have much preferred one complete story and I am anxiously awaiting another wonderful novel that will turn me into an Avolonian.

Delightful Christmas StoriesThis book is a delightful set of short stories around a Christmas theme. I want to move to the town of Avalon! I loved each story and the characters of the town. Just a nice quick read for the holiday season.
These were all heartwarming Christmas stories about friendship, family, and connection -- All of my favorite topics!

For fans of Friendship Bread and The Avalon Ladies Scrapbooking Society comes a delightful collection of stories that will put a smile on your face this holiday season.The holidays have finally arrived in Avalon, Illinois and everyone is filled with festive cheer. Well, maybe not everyone ...The husbands of Avalon have started a Bah Humbug Club. A neighborhood cookie exchange wreaks havoc on Erin Meeks' carefully planned life. Melvin O'Malley's daughter has abandoned him for the holidays in a senior facility, and shop owner Margot West is intent on creating the best holiday shopping experience for her customers when a stranger threatens to ruin it.But a few surprises await them as well--an anonymous donor is giving away free turkeys at the Pick and Save, and there's an air of mystery surrounding a generous raffle prize for the upcoming Christmas Bazaar. And when it looks like Santa might be a no show, someone unexpected steps into his boots.Celebrate the season with 12 heartwarming stories of hope and cheer that continue the spirit of Gee's first two novels, Friendship Bread and The Avalon Ladies Scrapbooking Society. Includes recipesThis is a book of 12 short stories, all centred around the town of Avalon. Most of the people have been living in the town for years, and not everyone is looking forward to the Christmas holidays. Some are feeling lonely as they have lost their loved ones, some are losing their business or their homes, whilst others try to see the best in the holidays.The stories have a loose link with each other and the reader ends up back where they started with the Senior Centre and the inhabitants there in.The stories are not too “twee” – there is a positive feeling at the end of each story, even if the overall situations are not the most positive.There are recipes at the end of the book, including a sough dough starter for sharing with others, and for which I will keep this ebook for reference later!These are not the most indepth set of stories: there is enough character development of the relevant people in each story, but these are short stories so that is appropriate – you get a decent enough indication of the people involved and what happens why. This is a nice light read for a busy time of year

Title: An Avalon ChristmasAuthor: Darien GeePublished: D.G.Reviewed By: Arlena DeanRating: 5Review:"An Avalon Christmas" by Darien Gee was a wonderful collection of short stories that took place in Avalon, Illinois. You will find from the read that this is a wonderful town to live in especially during the Christmas holiday season. These stories are of individuals lives and their dealings with the community during 'Christmas, a senior facility, anonymous giving and the Bah Humbug Club.' This author did a wonderful job with giving the reader a read that will lift your spirits of the Christmas holiday. Many of the stories brought tears along with some plenty of laughter. I think my favorite was the Bah Humbug story and I would truly recommend you pick up "A Avalon Christmas" to find out which one you like the best. I would recommend these stories because they are all beautifully written and these stories will be found so very heartwarming. So, with that being said I would recommend you to sit down and read about this special town in Avalon, Illinois.

Full of Christmas spirit. Well written, clever, and heartwarming stories that will anyone with the spirit of Christmas. I know. I've been down in the dumps having moved with my family to another Country. Even though Christmas is 10 days away it felt like a hundred to me. I decided to take a chance on this book, as I was looking for something that might make me feel more in to the holidays. I was less than 1/2 way through when I felt my heart warm like the Grinch's. The Author mentions Maeve Binchy in one of her stories and truth be told, and I don't say this lightly because Maeve Binchy is my all time favorite author, Darien Gee has a little of Maeve Binchy's style in her work.

Wonderful!!!!Love this book of short stories centered around the small community of Avalon. The characters are believable and so are the stories. You have Secret Santa. The Bah Humbug club, Neighbors helping each other, the Harmony Seniors, etc Avalon is a very friendly place with a variety of characters. I smiled, laughed, cried reading these stories. I do have a couple more stories to read but wanted to leave my review. This is a great Christmas read I will be enjoying it again next Christmas for sure. Highly recommended.

I've read every one of the Friendship Bread books so far and recommended them to friends. They are fantastic stories of friendship and community and people coming together to help each other out. We need more of this in the world. Things I love about this series:No mean people doing mean things.No inappropriate sexual behavior.No swearing.Great dialogue.Wonderful character development.Inspiring.

A Christmas Glimpse into Homes and Businesses in AvalonAvalon is everyone's favorite town. Here the spirit of giving and love comes alive. The author does a wonderful job of telling Avalon's stories in the form of chapter long short stories that reveal the lives and connectedness that are known as community. In the last chapter an ending is written to the first chapter which is a satisfying end to a well written tale that embodies the Christmas spirit.

Downloaded onto my laptop ages ago, but finally read on my new ipad :-) I had enjoyed the author's Friendship Bread (and enjoy the bread itself!) This read a lot like a short story collection, about the lives of everyone in a small town in the days leading up to Christmas. While I think they could have been connected a little better, I definitely became quite fond of them, and plan to read the novel about their Scrapbooking Society soon!

Delightful short storiesWhen I opened this book and realized it was a series of interrelated short stories, I almost stopped reading but am so happy I didn't. These are lovely, gentle stories which make you feel good. They are about the innate goodness of people. It was a wonderful Christmas read!

I enjoyed these gentle short stories about ordinary people and their community of Avalon. In some ways Avalon reminded me of the mythical Brigadoon - the village that appeared one day every 100 years, and so never changed. The changes in Avalon are more about the people than the place as each story's main character chooses the values most important in his or her life.

What a lovely Christmas book. And it is free on Amazon so ever better!Filled with stories that revolve around Christmas, a senior's facility, anonymous giving and a Bah Humbug Club. It is also filled with heartwarming tales that are perfect for the Christmas season. A light read that fill you with the spirit of Christmas. And there are recipes too.It's free, grab it now for goodness sake!

I love Avalon, the townspeople are so friendly and the town always comes together. I loved the idea of this book - each story someone doing something in the spirit of Christmas to make things better for others. But I felt it was very fragmented and didn't flow well. The only connection was the town. Few characters did I recognize from the previous two stories.

A nice selection of short stories just designed to bring you in the right Christmas spirit. Should only be read in December.Contents: Lemon Creams - Outside Pick and Save - Gift Wrapped - Raffle - Cookie Exchange - Late Bloomers - And We're Wassailing - Winterberry Wreath - Sleigh Bells - Scrooged - Room at the Tea Salon - Secret Santa

I usually don't like short stories but this collection were all connected to a small town, Avalon. Some of the characters show up again so it didn't feel like short stories to me. I continue to enjoy Darien Gee's touching, often times humorous stories.

I enjoyed itThis was a collection of short stories about Christmas in a small town called Avalon. Each chapter was a different story and they were sweet and uplifting. Just a bit too short. But enjoyable.

At the end of each story, I felt like I was left hanging. I am not sure if this was just starts and stops of story ideas she had or what. Nothing felt finished in this book, and I have more "why's" and "who's" in my head that most of my series books leave me with.

I loved delving into the lives and stories of the residents of Avalon. It seems like the ideal small town - I want to go there and meet the characters.I am definitely moving the other Avalon books to the top of my TBR list.

Loved this well-written book of vignette's depicting members of the small town of Avalon. I would love to live there! the Spirit of Christmas seems to live all the year long here. The stories were short but touching. Some were funny and there was even a little romance thrown in here and there.

Not exactly a page-turnerThis novel is intended to be a light and feel-good read, but it just seemed too contrite and naive. It was very simple both in literary context that it seemed like it was written by a beginner. I pushed through, but it wasn't a page-turner.

A collection of stories that express the season of Christmas through the community of Avalon. An excellent addition to the series of Avalon books by Darien Gee. I was entertained and engrossed with the stories of this imaginary town. I loved it! Very clean!

This sweet story collection has hooked me on the fictional town of Avalon and the wonderful cast of characters who live there. I enjoyed how the stories tied in together with some characters playing roles in more than one tale. The recipes at the end of the book are a bonus!

A charming series of vignettes centered around the "nicest town in America," Avalon, Illinois. The stories intersect, but each could stand on its own, and each is ultimately about finding or showing the spirit of Christmas.

description: This Christmas a secret hides around every corner in the small river town of Avalon, IL. Who's giving away free turkeys to every house in town? What is a mystery homeless man up to when he offers free gift-wrapping in front of the town's most popular gift shop? Is the annual town fundraiser raffle grand prize a hoax or the real deal? What happens when mystery gifts of generosity start showing up around town during the holidays and how do they change the lives of those who need them the most but expect them the least? Written with heart, wit and humor, An Avalon Christmas is filled with twelve heartwarming stories of hope and cheer that make every day Christmas, bringing laughter and tears to readers this holiday season. Includes recipes.
title: An Avalon Christmas
